metadata.title: An Empirical Model for n-gram Frequency Distribution in Large Corpora

body_text.text: The appearance of Web-scale corpora raised new challenges on the extraction of relevant expressions in natural languages, e.g. for indexing and time/space optimization, whose efficiency can benefit from the knowledge of the statistical regularities in real data. However, most studies only focus on single words, analyzing their occurrence frequencies. For example, function words such as “the”, “in”, “of”, lacking semantic content and having a small and fixed vocabulary essentially related to a language grammar, tend to occur more often than words like “oceanography” or “preferably”, whose appearance can be related to the semantic content of a text.
